ELEFANTES.name: Abul-Abbas
ELEFANTES.note: An elephant given to Carolingian emperor Charlemagne by the Abbasid caliph Harun al-Rashid.

ELEFANTES.name: Balarama
ELEFANTES.note: A lead elephant of the world-famous Mysore Dasara procession.

ELEFANTES.name: Lallah Rookh
ELEFANTES.note: A female elephant known for her tightrope walking act.

ELEFANTES.name: Queenie
ELEFANTES.note: Gave rides for children at Melbourne Zoo for 40 years.

ELEFANTES.name: Sauce
ELEFANTES.note: Salt and Sauce were once two of Britain's most famous and notorious performing elephants. Sauce killed her owner and trainer in an accident at Walthamstow Station and Salt killed an elephant groom when she attacked him in 1957 on Rosaire's Circus.

ELEFANTES.name: Black Diamond
ELEFANTES.note: Believed to be the largest Indian elephant in captivity.

ELEFANTES.name: Isilo
ELEFANTES.note: One of South Africa’s largest Africans and the largest living tusker (a male elephant with tusks weighing over 100 pounds) in the southern hemisphere before his death.

ELEFANTES.name: Kashin
ELEFANTES.note: Famous for being sponsored by ASB Bank, and featured in the New Zealand produced television programme The Zoo.

ELEFANTES.name: Mona
ELEFANTES.note: Thought, at 60, to have been the oldest Asian in the United States.

ELEFANTES.name: Drona
ELEFANTES.note: The lead Dasara Elephants of the Jamboo Savari of Mysore Dasara. He carried the Golden Howdah for a record 18 years consecutive years between 1981 and 1997, before being electrocuted while grazing in 1998.

ELEFANTES.name: Raja Gaj
ELEFANTES.note: Considered to be the world's largest Asian of modern times.

ELEFANTES.name: Tai
ELEFANTES.note: Known for featuring in the films Larger than Life and Water for Elephants.

ELEFANTES.name: Chengalloor Ranganathan
ELEFANTES.note: Considered the tallest Asian thatever lived. He was killed by another elephant during Arattupuzha Festival in 1927. The century-old skeleton of this elephant is exhibited in the Thrissur Museum in the Main Entrance hall.

ELEFANTES.name: Hattie
ELEFANTES.note: An elephant in New York City's Central Park Zoo that was described as the "most intelligent of all elephants" and "nearly human."

ELEFANTES.name: Fanny
ELEFANTES.note: A female elephant who spent the majority of her life in a small zoo.

ELEFANTES.name: John L. Sullivan
ELEFANTES.note: A boxing elephant in Adam Forepaugh's circus.

ELEFANTES.name: Lin Wang
ELEFANTES.note: Served with the Chinese Expeditionary Force during the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937–1945) and later relocated to Taiwan with the Kuomintang forces.

ELEFANTES.name: The Cremona Elephant
ELEFANTES.note: A gift presented to Holy Roman Emperor Frederick II by Sultan of Egypt Al-Kamil, in 1229. Frederick used the elephant in his triumph parades.

ELEFANTES.name: Hanno
ELEFANTES.note: The pet white elephant given by King Manuel I of Portugal to Pope Leo X at his coronation.
